content: one round with single_crochet instead of double_crochet when you reach the ch1 space do a group of single_crochet ch6 single_crochet in the space try on your sweater again and make sure the ch6 fits around your finger add or subtract chains as needed if you do not want to be able to attach your sweater to your finger you can just add sc3 in the ch1 space single_crochet to the end of the round do not slip stitch cut your yarn and pull through attach your yarn needle pull yarn through the stitch from the first single_crochet and then through the stitch from the last single_crochet tie off weave in the end step four wear your perfect fit raglan sweater like it was made just for you because it was final comments thank you for your interest in my design i know it s more confusing than a row by row pattern but i hope this allowed you to make a sweater that fits your body perfectly please don t hesitate to email me with any questions meghansteel@outlook com if you struggle with any of these techniques i can send you to the videos or blogs that helped me learn also send me any improvements or recommended changes to this text as you may have a better description than i do for some of these techniques and please if you feel like sharing a photo on instagram tag me @meghanbetty so i can see the result i may eventually create a row by row pattern with specific instructions for different sizes feel free to follow me on ravelry mbsteel in case i find the time to create this version of the design
